citations.title: Tesla Vehicle Production & Deliveries and Date for ...
citations.summary: In Q4 2023, Tesla produced approximately 495,000 vehicles and delivered over 484,000, with Model 3/Y accounting for 476,777 units produced and 461,538 delivered. For the entire year of 2023, Tesla's total vehicle production reached 1,845,985, while deliveries amounted to 1,808,581, reflecting a year-over-year growth of 35% in production and 38% in deliveries. The figures indicate a strong performance in both production and delivery metrics for Tesla.

citations.title: Tesla Fourth Quarter 2024 Production, Deliveries & ...
citations.summary: In the fourth quarter of 2024, Tesla produced around 459,000 vehicles and achieved deliveries exceeding 495,000 vehicles. This performance highlights a significant increase in production and delivery rates compared to previous quarters. The data reflects Tesla's ongoing efforts to scale its manufacturing capabilities and meet growing demand.

citations.title: 10-K
citations.summary: The drive inverter in the vehicle converts direct current (DC) from the battery pack into alternating current (AC) for three-phase induction motors and also converts AC from regenerative braking back into DC for storage. This process is managed by a high-performance digital signal processor that runs complex software. To protect their core technology and intellectual property, the company employs a mix of patents, trade secrets, nondisclosure agreements, and other legal protections.

citations.title: Supercharger
citations.summary: Superchargers can provide up to 200 miles of electric vehicle range in just 15 minutes, making them a quick and efficient charging solution. Charging sessions are usually brief, as topping off the battery beyond 80 percent is often unnecessary.

citations.title: Manufacturing
citations.summary: The manufacturing facility has the capability to produce over one million vehicles annually, alongside energy products and battery cells. This extensive production capacity highlights the company's commitment to scaling its operations in the automotive and energy sectors.

citations.title: Q2 2025 Update
citations.summary: In Q2 2025, energy storage deployments are increasing, driven by the expansion of capacity for both Megapack and Powerwall systems to satisfy global demand. This growth reflects ongoing advancements in energy storage technology and infrastructure.

TRL.rationale: The Tesla 800V platform is operational and supports high-voltage systems for electric vehicles, indicating a high level of technology readiness as it is proven in a commercial environment.

MRL.rationale: Tesla has demonstrated significant production capabilities with a 35% year-over-year growth, indicating readiness for full-rate production, though some scaling challenges may still exist.

CRAAP.rationale: The information is current and relevant, with authoritative sources, but some details are less specific, affecting accuracy slightly.

Materiality.rationale: The technology is critical to Tesla's business model and sustainability strategy, making it highly material to stakeholders.

ISSB.rationale: Tesla's focus on electric vehicle technology aligns with sustainability goals, but specific KPIs related to IFRS S1/S2 are not fully detailed.

OTA_Compliance.rationale: Tesla's OTA updates align with ISO 24089 and UNECE R156 standards, demonstrating compliance with advanced software update protocols.
